text: FRANKFURT, May 12 Germanys biggest power producer RWE expects meaningful discussions about tighter climate targets and faster coal plant closures not before early 2022, chief finance officer Michael Mueller said on Wednesday.Mueller said a new Berlin government needed to be formed after general elections in September, where the Greens are currently leading in polls.Asked about implications from the Berlin cabinets approval for a stricter climate law on Wednesday, Mueller said that RWE had adopted a long-term decarbonisation strategy away from coal and was confident in that position. (Reporting by Vera Eckert and Christoph Steitz, editing by Riham Alkousaa)
